intro: Erigeron leptorhizon, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and prairies, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white to pale blue, with ray florets that resemble petals. Erigeron leptorhizon is often found in disturbed areas and can serve as a food source for various pollinators.
